meanings.definition: To smear or spread (a substance) thinly or unevenly.
meanings.sent1: She was schmeering the paint on the canvas with quick strokes.
meanings.sent2: He schmeered the butter on the toast before adding jam.
meanings.sent3: The toddler tried schmeering the mashed potatoes all over the table.
meanings.sent4: The artist schmeered the colors together, creating a beautiful blend.
meanings.sent5: The chef demonstrated schmeering the sauce evenly across the dish.

meanings.definition: To manipulate or deceive in a sly or underhanded way.
meanings.sent1: The con artist was schmeering his victims with false promises.
meanings.sent2: She suspected her coworker was schmeering information to gain an advantage.
meanings.sent3: The magician was schmeering the audience with his sleight of hand tricks.
meanings.sent4: The politician was schmeering the facts to sway public opinion.
meanings.sent5: The spy was schmeering his way through enemy lines undetected.
